channel.title: Home on Andrews Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Andrews Blog

item.title: Testing it all...
item.description:
1. https://validator.w3.org/

Check your html for errors.

  1. http://jigsaw.w3.org/css-validator/

Check your CSS files for errors.

  1. https://www.webpagetest.org/

Check site loading speed.

  1. https://search.google.com/

Check that your analytics code and sitemap.xml are being read correctly by Google.

  1. https://developers.google.com/speed/pagespeed/insights

  2. https://search.google.com/test/mobile-friendly

  3. https://seositecheckup.com/

item.title: Create a clickable script
item.description:
Using Textedit or similar create a file on your Desktop and call it:

myscript.command.sh

Then enter your lines of code, for example:
cd /
open https://google.com

You can leave out the usual #!/bin/sh part on the first line.

Then make it executable, by running chmod from the MacOS Terminal:
cd /
cd /users/yourusername/desktop
chmod +x myscript.command

Finally, set it to always open in Terminal by right-clicking on the file, select “Get info”, select “Open with” and then select Terminal.

Test your shell script by double-clicking on it, you should see Google.

item.title: Simple deploy script
item.description:
A script to automatically push to Github, then deploy to Netlify.

To display the code correctly be sure to click the “Read more” tag below.

cd /

cd your_directory

rm -rf public

hugo

git init

git add public

git commit -m ‘First commit’

git remote add origin https://github.com/github_username/repo_name.git

git fetch origin master

git push -f origin master

Notes:

  1. There are single quotes around ‘First commit’ Use double quotes only if you are using Windows.

  2. -f after push means force. Use with caution.
